title: Joe Allen reveals Neil Taylor's dressing room reaction to Seamus Coleman's broken leg
text:
Sport Joe Allen reveals Neil Taylor's dressing room reaction to Seamus Coleman's broken leg Taylor's high challenge left Coleman with a gruesome injury and the Everton man is facing a long spell out Share Neil Taylor was shown a red card for his leg-breaking challenge on Seamus Coleman (Photo: PA Wire) Share   
Joe Allen revealed Neil Taylor was "in bits" after his sickening challenge on Seamus Coleman left the Irishman with a broken leg. 
Coleman is facing a lengthy spell on the sidelines after suffering the horrific injury in Friday's World Cup qualifier between the Republic of Ireland and Wales in Dublin. 
Aston Villa defender Taylor was shown a straight red card for his challenge on Coleman and Allen admitted his countryman and former Swansea teammate was dejected after the game. 
"He’s in bits, to be honest," Allen said when asked about Taylor's state of mind. "Tayls is one of my best mates and he’s a great guy and he’s really disappointed that one of his tackles has ended up getting someone hurt. 
"But unfortunately in football these things can happen. Coleman is facing a length spell out (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
"There was no malice in the tackle and he certainly wouldn’t have intended to hurt anyone. 
"I know him as well as anyone and I think everyone is disappointed and from Seamus’ point of view it doesn’t look great." 
Allen was involved in an unsavoury incident of his own when he clashed with Stoke teammate Glen Whelan. 
The Wales midfielder reacted angrily to what he perceived to be an elbow from Whelan and the pair had to be separated by other players. Joe Allen and Glenn Whelan clashed in Dublin (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Allen played down the incident after the match. 
"He’s given me assurances that he didn’t mean it," Allen said. "It happens when you come up against players you know, teammates, and there’s no hard feelings at all. 
"I’ll have to see it back. At the time I thought I was caught by an elbow. Who knows? But I couldn’t really care less at this point." Like us on Facebook
